hmm
i read a book on elasticsearch on vacation
i honestly dont remember much about what i read because i was drinkin at the same time

LOL nice
however
i do want to do two things
1. users will be backed by elasticsearch
2. lets just suck it up and move decks to elasticsearch
sounds fun to me
also
let’s use amazon’s elasticsearch
hosted
honestly once we figure out the best way to do joins (in python?) the rest shouldn’t be too bad, just basically have to redo everything in database.py
so i dont think we need to do joins
i think what we do is we just keep doing tally in database.py
just pull the decks from the ES, instead of the `get_decks` business
we also have to pull things out like usage stats and shit like that, but i think ES is going to be fast enough we might just be able to do it on the fly
basically do “joins” in python, not ES-side
<http://shop.oreilly.com/product/0636920028505.do>

attachments.title: Elasticsearch: The Definitive Guide
attachments.text: Whether you need full-text search or real-time analytics of structured data—or both—the Elasticsearch distributed search engine is an ideal way to put your data to work. This practical ...

text: you should read this book
at least the first half
it has some “optional” chapters that do a good job of explaining how shit works behind the scenes, picking good schemas, good number of splits, replicas, shit like that
feel free to expense it or whatever
cool I’ll go ahead and order a copy
kk

like if i want to do user accounts first, or do decks later

i kinda want to bang it out because it’s smaller than social

so its synchronous
